message.content:
<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: Add a blank line at the end of each Java class file.
<<<explanation>>>: The Checkstyle message 'File does not end with a newline' is triggered when a Java class file does not have a blank line at the end. To get rid of this message, simply add a blank line at the end of each Java class file in your project. This can be done by pressing Enter at the end of the last line of code in each file.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: Add the following configuration to your Checkstyle configuration file:
<module name="RegexpSinglelineJava">
    <property name="format" value="\Z"/>
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline."/>
</module>
<<<explanation>>>: This configuration will add a regular expression check to ensure that each file ends with a newline character.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by modifying the Checkstyle configuration file (checkstyle.xml) and adding the following rule:
<module name="RegexpSinglelineJava">
    <property name="format" value=".*" />
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline" />
</module>
This rule will match any line in the Java file and ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message. Make sure to place this rule before any other rules in the configuration file.
<<<explanation>>>: By adding this rule to the Checkstyle configuration file, you are telling Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by adding the following configuration to your Checkstyle configuration file (checkstyle.xml):

<module name="RegexpMultiline">
    <property name="format" value=".*" />
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline" />
</module>

This configuration will match any line and ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message.

You can also configure NetBeans to automatically add a newline at the end of each file by going to Tools > Options > Editor > Formatting and selecting the "Ensure trailing line break at end of file" option.

<<<explanation>>>: The Checkstyle configuration will ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message, and the NetBeans configuration will automatically add a newline at the end of each file to prevent the message from appearing.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by adding the following configuration to your Checkstyle configuration file:
<module name="RegexpSinglelineJava">
  <property name="format" value=".*" />
  <property name="message" value="Ignore File does not end with a newline" />
</module>
This will match any line in the Java file and ignore the message for all lines.
<<<explanation>>>: The above code snippet will configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message for all lines in the Java file.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: Add a newline at the end of the file in question.
<<<explanation>>>: The Checkstyle message 'File does not end with a newline' indicates that the file in question does not have a newline character at the end. To get rid of this message, simply add a newline at the end of the file.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by adding the following configuration to your Checkstyle configuration file:

<module name="RegexpSinglelineJava">
    <property name="format" value=".*" />
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline" />
    <property name="ignoreComments" value="true" />
</module>

This configuration will ignore the message for all Java files. If you want to ignore the message for specific files only, you can use the "file" attribute of the <module> element to specify the file pattern.

You can also configure NetBeans to automatically add a newline at the end of each file by going to Tools -> Options -> Editor -> Formatting and checking the "Ensure final line end with newline" option.

<<<explanation>>>: The first code snippet shows how to configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message. The second explanation suggests configuring NetBeans to automatically add a newline at the end of each file to avoid the message.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by adding the following configuration to your Checkstyle configuration file:

<module name="RegexpSingleline">
    <property name="format" value=".*"/>
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline."/>
    <property name="ignoreComments" value="true"/>
</module>

This will tell Checkstyle to ignore any violations of the "File does not end with a newline" rule.

Alternatively, you can also configure your IDE (Netbeans) to automatically add a newline at the end of each file. In Netbeans, go to Tools -> Options -> Editor -> Formatting -> Java and check the "Ensure trailing line break" option.

<<<explanation>>>: The first solution configures Checkstyle to ignore the specific message "File does not end with a newline" by using the RegexpSingleline module. The second solution configures Netbeans to automatically add a newline at the end of each file.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by adding the following configuration to your Checkstyle configuration file (typically named checkstyle.xml):

<module name="RegexpMultiline">
    <property name="format" value=".+" />
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline" />
</module>

This will match any line in the file and ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message.

Alternatively, you can add a newline at the end of each file to satisfy the Checkstyle rule.

<<<explanation>>>: The Checkstyle plugin is configured to check for a newline at the end of each file by default. This message is a warning that the file does not end with a newline character. You can either configure Checkstyle to ignore this message or add a newline at the end of each file to satisfy the Checkstyle rule.

<<<api>>>: Checkstyle
<<<code>>>: You can configure Checkstyle to ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message by adding the following configuration in your Checkstyle configuration file (checkstyle.xml):

<module name="RegexpSinglelineJava">
    <property name="format" value=".*" />
    <property name="message" value="File does not end with a newline" />
</module>

This configuration will match any line in the Java file and ignore the "File does not end with a newline" message.

Alternatively, you can add a newline at the end of every Java file to satisfy the Checkstyle rule.

<<<explanation>>>: The Checkstyle message "File does not end with a newline" is triggered when a Java file does not have a newline character at the end. Checkstyle considers this as a violation of coding standards. By configuring Checkstyle to ignore this message, you can prevent it from being reported in the Checkstyle reports.
